definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: Dozens of dead cats were found in plastic bins around the house.
sentences.chinese: 從散落在屋裏的塑料箱內還發現了幾十只貓的屍體。

sentences.english: Dozens of hoses snaked through open doors or holes in the walls.
sentences.chinese: 從門洞和牆洞裏伸出許多水管，盤繞散落。

sentences.english: There were rocks underfoot and boulders about them, rough to the touch like scoria.
sentences.chinese: 粗糙的石頭散落在腳下，也矗立在身邊。

sentences.english: The hotel lobby was a mess of glass and bricks.
sentences.chinese: 酒店大廳到處是散落的碎玻璃和磚塊。

sentences.english: Are plugs of compacted soil produced through aeration of fairways loose impediments?
sentences.chinese: 球道中積水井蓋上散落的淤泥算不算散置障礙物？

sentences.english: The women in red shirts are with necked-back and dotting in the classical garden.
sentences.chinese: 紅裙女子，赤裸背影，散落在古典的庭院裏。

sentences.english: Some are strewed with peonies, bats and other auspicious patterns to bring the owner good fortune.
sentences.chinese: 一些散落的牡丹，蝙蝠等吉祥圖案帶來好運氣的人。

sentences.english: Her hair straggled over her shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 她的頭髮散落在她的肩膀上。

sentences.english: It broken up into scraps of songs and lay scattered at your feet.
sentences.chinese: 它破裂成歌的碎片，散落在你的腳下。

sentences.english: Black fragments as large as apples landed in the desert.
sentences.chinese: 蘋果一樣大的黑色碎片散落在沙漠中。

sentences.english: Today the remains of these "ghost towns" are scattered about Death Valley.
sentences.chinese: 而今的人去房空的“鬼城”散落在死亡谷上。

sentences.english: When he bends to pick it up, he knocks over his portfolio and papers fall out.
sentences.chinese: 當他彎身去揀時，又撞翻了公文包，文件散落一地。

sentences.english: Never said that before the separation, have been scattered in the earth.
sentences.chinese: 那些以前說着永不分離的人，早已經散落在天涯了。

sentences.english: Above me, the stars are specks of silver paint on a charcoal canvas.
sentences.chinese: 在我頭頂上方，星星如散落在木炭畫布上的銀色斑點。

sentences.english: A few minutes later, a noisy rain begins to scatter itself across the rooftops.
sentences.chinese: 幾分鐘後，一陣嘈雜的雨開始散落在屋頂。

sentences.english: There are several scattered pavilions and teahouses throughout the park.
sentences.chinese: 有幾個亭子散落其間，茶室遍佈公園。

definition: to leave behind (inadvertently)/to forget/to omit/to leave out
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
to disperse/to scatter in all directions
